sub_title: Staff Software Engineer, Quality Engineering Lead at ServiceNow
summary:
I'm very determined, focused and always willing to learn new technologies.
I aim to develop great quality products, regardless of platform or paradigm.
I also defend that all knowledge should be shared, so the community can grow. To do my part, I participated in some lectures on local Software development events in Brazil, such as "Minas testing conference", "Google developers conference", "QA Sampa meeting" and "GaroaQA" where I was the co-creator and the organizer. I maintain a publication on medium focused on quality assurance and best practices of development AssertQualityAssurance (Portuguese and English).

contributors.headline: Staff Software Engineer, Quality Engineering Lead at ServiceNow

profile_positions.description: Excited about the new challenges, leading 3 teams and 5 QE's
profile_positions.title: Staff Software Engineer, Quality Engineering Lead
Senior Software Engineer, Quality Engineering Lead

profile_positions.description:
Working on Performance Analytics (Charts and Analytics) within the ServiceNow Platform, participating in all steps of SDLC, maintaining more than 25k automated tests, trying out new tools with POC's, and migrating legacy test framework to a new test framework.
Guiding new joiners and less experienced Quality engineers also tutoring developers to understand agile testing.
As a challenge using expertise in Agile Testing to improve the SDLC on my team to create shared ownership of quality (Shift Left)
Keys achievements: Received two UTG Awards in 2022 Q1 and Q2 for high-performance contributor
profile_positions.title: Senior Software Engineer, Automation

profile_positions.description: Part of the Mobile Business Banking App, working with Native Tools such as XCUiTest and Espresso, helping to bring automation to a different level within the product. Also part of the team responsible for releases and implementing POCs for new tooling or concepts.
profile_positions.title: Senior Software Engineer, Automation

profile_positions.description:
Working on the Support APP team, using native test automation tools such as Espresso and EarlGrey, writing new tools in Ruby to support CI and productivity, using Ansible to provide constant maintenance on CI machines, teaching engineers how to think in test first and how to split tests between different layer in the application, pushing test towards the beginning of the process, responsible to all regression cycles in the team. Also given mentorship about test automation and API testing.
Keeping crash-free sessions above 99.655 on both platforms
profile_positions.title: Senior Software Engineer, Automation

profile_positions.description: Working on the Support APP team, using native test automation tools such as Espresso and EarlGrey, writing new tools in Ruby to support CI and productivity, using Ansible to provide constantly maintenance on CI machines, teaching engineers how to think in test first and how to split tests between different layer in the application, pushing test towards the beginning of the process, responsible to all regression cycles in the team. Also given mentorship about test automation and API testing.
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer, Automation

profile_positions.description:
acting on 3 fronts in an agile team

Business: 
Pair with the Product owner to help a improve better user stories and refining acceptant criteria, ever thinking about alternative/errors flows.
Broadcast new to the delivery team using specification by example as living documentation.

Test automation:
End-to-end automation of the most value developed features, maintain constantly the tests through continuous integration, API testing such as integration tests and contract even exploring the most value scenários to business and final user. Thinking about that all the test are code so at all times looking for code quality, design, performance and best practices.

Pair with developers:
Helping the developers to write unit test, UI unit such as (Espresso, XCUItest, KIF). So the purpose is preventing the bug and not hunting his.

Technical support to the teams:
As a Chapter Lead, one of my attributions is a help to solute reals problems on several teams enhance product quality on the life cycle development till the final user, develop solutions and maintainer open sources testing projects.

Interviews, challenges corrections, and technical development:
Interview new candidates for quality assurance position evaluating the knowledge in quality assurance and development best practices.
As a technician reference, I execute pair with other QA's to improve knowledge using DOJO's and apply training focused on quality assurance and DevOps.

profile_positions.title: Software Engineer

volunteer_experiences.description:
The Developers Conference is one of the major Brazilian technology conferences. There are more than 40 tracks. In 2017 I was invited to co-coordinate the track and in 2018 I got my submission approved to have my own track.

My responsibilities was:

- Judge talk proposals from Call for Papers
- Mentor speakers
- Share informations about the conference on social networks
- Introduce speakers
- Manage time and handle tech issues

Website:

http://www.thedevelopersconference.com.br/tdc/2018/saopaulo/trilha-testes

Given mentorship regarding:

Agile testing
Mobile testing
API testing

Assert Quality Assurance is a medium publication focused on software engineer and quality that I'm a curator and also writer.
the idea is to use that page to share knowledge and give an opportunity for people to share their knowledge.

https://medium.com/assertqualityassurance
Cycled 800km on July/23 to raise money for Omunga, we cycled from Amsterdam to Dublin in 5 days and a half and we were able to raise more than 7k dollars.
